tasks.name: Random generation task
tasks.description: Participants were presented with a timing signal and instructed to press buttons in a random sequence in the experimental condition, while in the baseline condition they pressed buttons in a stereotyped sequence.

tasks.name: Alphabet task
tasks.description: Participants alternated between stimulus-oriented (SO) and stimulus-independent (SI) phases. During SO phases, participants classified capital letters based on straight lines or curves, while in SI phases, they mentally continued the alphabet sequence.
